content.description: A study reported that <math alttext="14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>14</mn></math> percent of cars registered in <math alttext="2015" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2015</mn></math> had a manual transmission. An automotive researcher collected data on cars registered in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> to investigate whether the proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission is less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.14</mtext></math>. The researcher took a random sample of <math alttext="150" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn></math> cars registered in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> and found <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn></math> of the cars had a manual transmission.
content.question: After ensuring the conditions for inference were met, the researcher conducted an appropriate hypothesis test and calculated a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value of <math alttext="0.24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.24</mn></math>. At the <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> percent level of significance, which of the following conclusions should be made?

choices.label: The null hypothesis should be rejected. There is significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

The null hypothesis should be rejected. There is not significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

The null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is not less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

The null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is equal to <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

The null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is not significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

content.answer: The null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is not significant evidence that the population proportion of registered cars with a manual transmission in <math alttext="2021" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2021</mn></math> is less than <math alttext="0.14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.14</mn></math>.

topic.text: 6.6: Concluding a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
